case_title: ABDUL JABBAR and 180 others vs SECRETARY, HEALTH DEPARTMENT, GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN and others
respondant: Secretary, Health Department, Government of Balochistan
complaint_summary: Appellants challenged the cancellation of their appointments in Bolan Medical College, alleging violation of natural justice and procedural irregularities.
investigation_summary: An Inquiry Committee constituted by the Health Department of Balochistan investigated the appointments and found them illegal, recommending cancellation of appointment orders.
judgment_summary: The court remanded the case for de novo proceedings under the Balochistan Employees Efficiency and Discipline Act, 2013 (BEEDA). The impugned order dated 24-4-2014 was set aside, and appellants were reinstated without back benefits to face inquiry.
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded for de novo proceedings; appellants reinstated without back benefits.
legal_arguments: Violation of natural justice and audi alteram partem principle.
Appointments made without adhering to BEEDA provisions.
Cancellation of appointments without show-cause notice or personal hearing.
statutes: Balochistan Employees Efficiency and Discipline Act, 2013
sections: Section 4 of the Balochistan Service Tribunal Act, 1974
key_issues: Illegal appointments in Bolan Medical College.
Violation of procedural requirements under BEEDA.
Non-issuance of show-cause notice and personal hearing.

maxims.audi alteram partem: The principle that no one should be condemned unheard.

legal_terms.de novo proceedings: Fresh proceedings conducted from the beginning.

words_and_phrases.natural justice: Legal principles ensuring fairness in decision-making.

summary_vector_notes: The appellants contested the cancellation of their appointments, alleging procedural violations and lack of natural justice. The court remanded the case for fresh proceedings under BEEDA, reinstating the appellants without back benefits.
